alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henry, Clay, southwestern Randolph and northwestern Early Counties through 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/... At 331 PM EDT/231 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Fort Gaines to 6 miles southwest of Abbeville. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Newville, Bellville, Haleburg, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Bonapartes Retreat, Tumbleton, Standleys Store, Hayes, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Ricks Place, Pecan, Graball, Dancey and Thomas Mill Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
